column4: hello, im currently having issues getting a external usb wifi adapter to work on my desktop using centos and am thinking about switching to ubuntu
i want to set up a NFS server
should i get the desktop or server edition
any1 havea suggestion?
what is the problem under centos?  do you know who made the adapter?
i know what it is, im just wondering if i would be better suited with the ubuntu server edition over the desktop edition
yea, belkin
it could need some strange firmware in order to operate
well, i tried installing wicd
and that didnt work
ithey pointed to to a linux driver page
and i found the driver it uses
so it must be in the distro i have
it just wont work
and i dont care about guis, i like the terminal
what's the model number?
oops, F5D9050
its a desktop, this is external
looks like rt73 driver is needed.
other than having a gui is there anything the desktop is better at?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/RalinkRT73
